lines.text:
[Indicating a very old book]
The Mazarin Bible, the first work of Gutenberg printed in 1450.
I thought it was in two volumes.
lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony

lines.text: You're right, Brother Anthony. Christopher Columbus' son borrowed the second volume and, uh, never returned it.
I am Mrs. James Reavis, and one of us must have the dignity to accept punishment. One of us must have the dignity to recognize love. I'll always love you. Nothing can change that.

lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony

lines.text: I'll want you until the day I die. It is not death - it is dying that alarms me. it is not your crime - it is your weakness that alarms me.
There's only one thing about this case I can't understand.

lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony

lines.text: After devoting so many years to this scheme, what made you confess?
I fell in love with my wife.
lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony

lines.text: I've known many women, but with you, I'm afraid.
lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony

lines.text: A wanderer like Cain looking for a woman of my own.
lines.character: James Addison 'The Baron' Reavis, aka Brother Anthony
